abstract.text: mimik Client Library provides a programmatic way to work with the edgeEngine Runtime to access information about the mobile device on which the application is running.

inlineContent.text: The purpose of the mimik Client Library is to provide a programmatic way to work with the edgeEngine Runtime to access information about the mobile device on which the application is running, as well as mobile devices running within a cluster of mobile devices that are hosting the edgeEngine Runtime. Also, to allow developers to use edge microservices running within a particular cluster.

By leveraging the Core component of the mimik Client Library, developers can build applications compatible with the edgeEngine Runtime. This not only harnesses the strength of edge computing but also provides an inherent flexibility in its paradigm.

Additionally, this component provides utility APIs that help developers with core operations such as Authentication, edgeEngine Runtime Setup, deployment of edge microservices and handling of Network calls.
Furthermore, the mimik Client Library Engine component provides additional edgeEngine Runtime utility APIs, as well as vendoring the actual edgeEngine Runtime binary into the iOS project.

abstract.text: Deploys (installs) an edge microservice to the edgeEngine platform.

Activate external edgeEngine support for a specific host IP address and a port number. For example, for an edgeEngine instance running on a macOS, enter “192.168.1.100” as the host, and 8083 as the port.
Url components of the edgeEngine Runtime service link.
Returns the selected backend environment. Production is used as the default if none is specified.
Set the mimik client library’s backend environment. Production is used as the default if none is specified.
Returns whether edgeEngine Runtime Lifecycle is being automatically managed by the mimik Client Library Engine component.

Synchronously shuts down edgeEngine Runtime and erases its working directory, stored license and startup parameters. As well as any deployed edge microservices and their data. Essentially creating a brand new edgeEngine instance.

Sets the client library logging level for a specific subsystem. This does not control the edgeEngine Runtime console log output level (which is set in the MIMIKStartupParameters configuration object).
Synchronously shuts down edgeEngine.

Normally this API doesn’t need to be called as the port number would be managed automatically. However, under special circumstances this API can be called to set a custom port number for the edgeEngine platform to work on. This API can only be called once per application’s installation. It’s either called automatically by the mimik client library during the first edgeEngine startup or manually by the developer. Once the port number has been established, it cannot be changed again.
Returns whether edgeEngine Runtime is currently running.
Returns last known edgeEngine startup parameters.
mimik Client Library provides a programmatic way to work with the edgeEngine Runtime to access information about the mobile device on which the application is running.
Path to the edgeEngine working directory.
A static string representing the expected version of the vendored edgeEngine binary.
Path to the edgeEngine working directory.
Asynchronous main thread blocking edgeEngine startup. If edgeEngine is already running a success is returned. If edgeEngine is being started an error is returned.
Path to generic directories.
Path to the edgeEngine working directory.
Health and version check for a backend microservice.
Path to the edgeEngine working directory.
List of currently deployed edge microservice images.
The purpose of the mimik Client Library is to provide a programmatic way to work with the edgeEngine Runtime to access information about the mobile device on which the application is running
List of currently deployed edge microservices.
String representation of the edgeEngine Runtime Url components service link.
Running state of the edgeEngine Runtime.
Updates a deployed edge microservice version. Optionally updates the environment config values as well.
Deployed edge microservice image for a given image id.
List of currently deployed edge microservice containers.
Path to the edgeEngine working directory.
A token identifiyng the current edgeEngine Runtime instance. This id token is used for authentication calls.
External edgeEngine support status.
Updates a deployed edge microservice configuration. Replaces the full set of environment config values.
Synchronously shuts down edgeEngine and then restarts it again using the last known startup parameters.
Useful information about the current edgeEngine Runtime instance.
Deployed edge microservice container for a given container id.

A mimik Client Library Engine component initializer. This component is used to facilitate the integration of the edgeEngine Runtime binary directly within the iOS application sandbox, by vendoring the edgeEngine binary inside the
pod component.
